intro: Rhodamnia uniflora, commonly known as the single-flowered rhodamnia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a leathery texture, while its bark is smooth and greyish. Rhodamnia uniflora is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
